results.title: A Night at the show
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin and Essanay Film Manufacturing Company
results.brief_description: Based on a skit from Chaplin’s vaudeville days with Charlie in a dual role as a gentleman in evening dress and as a hobo. Both wreak havoc at the theatre.

results.title: A Nice sort of accident to have
results.brief_description: A report on progress toward car safety, illustrating the differences in approach found in Britain and the USA. Considers statistics relating to accidents, current driver psychology research, reasons for Britain’s need to follow US regulation to maintain exports, and the “airbag”. Also comments on the fact that New South Wales has declared compulsory seat belt wearing.

results.title: A Nice place to be (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dave McRae, Patricia Edgar and La Trobe University. Centre for the Study of Educational Communication and Media
results.brief_description: Looks at the aims and problems of the Sydney Road Community School, an alternative community school in Melbourne, and the nature of the experiment undertaken there. Each child is allowed to choose which subjects he wishes to take and which class he goes into with a particular teacher.

results.title: A New vision
results.creator_credit: John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A short series of films about great artists which aims to entertain and excite audience attention as well as to inform, by blending computer animation and graphics, traditional animation and, where appropriate, live action with shots of the works under discussion.

results.title: A New look at the sun
results.brief_description: Describes the radioheliograph at the CSIRO Solar Observatory at Culgoora, near Narrabri, N.S.W. This large circular array of 96 antennae provides a unique instrument for observing brief solar surface disturbances.

results.title: A new day in Samoa
results.brief_description: The people of Western Samoa and their progress toward self-government. The pattern of village life, growing cash crops, Apia the capital and chief port, parades, Robert Louis Stevenson’s grave, building new churches, the work of health sisters, education, internal self government, New Zealand administration and economic assistance, the combination of British and Samoan tradition.

results.title: A Nation of shopkeepers
results.creator_credit: British Productivity Council and World Wide
results.brief_description: Intelligent use of Method Study can help any trader, shopkeeper, distributor or manufacturer. The example of an ironmonger’s shop shows how analysis of work is applied to the retail trade, leading to lower costs, higher turnovers, less waste of time and money, and greater satisfaction to both staff and customers. How to keep the cost of changes of layout and method involved to a minimum.

results.title: A Most attractive man
results.creator_credit: Rivka Hartman, Gillian Coote, A Most Attractive Man Productions and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Dorian gets by on his looks, and lives off Frances, a single mother of three kids. He doesn’t contribute much to either her emotional or financial well being. Frances is running out of patience and Dorian’s looks are fading. Described as a “sardonic Australian love story” and made on a $50,000 budget this quirky short film won the Australian Film Institute Jury Award in 1982. Cast includes Carole Skinner, Grigor Taylor, Julie McGregor, Dennis Miller, Anna Volska, Cathy Downes, Anne Tenney, Rivka Hartman.
